page.title: 03BATTLESDEN
page.content:
Four cottages built by the Duke of Bedford in the 1880s, two farms and the rectory and{Church of St. Peter {and All Saints}make up the village which can only be reached by two minor roads. One of these coming in from the south, is in fact gated and contains two cattle-grids.
The parish, about 1500 acres all told, contains 54 people and 15 households at the 1961 census. In 1377, 128 people lived in the area in 21 houses.
The church, dating from the 13th Century, is still used, sharing a vicar with Milton Bryan and Woburn.
A 28 acre private park,{Battlesden {Park,}which includes a 13 acre lake constructed in 1821, lies between the village and the A5 road.
